title: Typography in Japan recommendations?
content:
Hi,

Currently in Japan. Looking for any interesting typography related places to visit. Roman characters or otherwise.

Anyone have any recommendations?

Thanks
author: noftus

comments.content: I, a Japanese, would recommend you to go to see any shop sign of traditional Japanese restaurant (normally printed on cotton material) in terms of calligraphy.

Take a walk through a light industrial area. That's where the true Japanese font wonders lie. You'll find bizarre interpretations our our alphabet, grungy kanji stencil fonts and clunky scripts with descenders chopped off. Bonus: slogans such as "We love wood and humans!"

\>You’ll find bizarre interpretations our our alphabet, grungy kanji stencil fonts and clunky scripts with descenders chopped off.

Ray, I can't wait to see your new designs! :-)

_Bonus: slogans such as “We love wood and humans!”_  
Be sure to visit a couple of 100 yen stores for those, too:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924im_/http:/typophile.com/files/surely-use_4718.jpg)

Apart from that, just walking around can already be total typographic input overload. I second the restaurants – [lettershapes everywhere](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo03/DSCF0021_1.JPG), some [beautiful calligraphy](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo06/P1010548.JPG) (and/or [funky stuff](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo06/P1010538.JPG)). But even just [stenciled signs](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo06/P1010515.JPG), [traffic directions painted on streets](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo06/P1010517.JPG), or LED signs are just… amazing. I found it especially funky how the different alphabets/scripts are combined and interchanged (like [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo07/P1010677.JPG)).

BTW if you're in/near Tokyo, and interested in graffiti: while Tokyo doesn't seem to have any really, [Yokohama does](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820165924/http:/homepage.mac.com/altairas_eye/.Pictures/tokyo07/P1010752.JPG).
